title: American Gothic
description: American Gothic is a 1930 painting by Grant Wood in the collection of the Art Institute of Chicago. Wood was inspired to paint what is now known as the American Gothic House in Eldon, Iowa, along with the kind of people he fancied should live in that house.
exhibition_history: Exhibited at the Art Institute of Chicago since 1930
text: This iconic American painting depicts a farmer holding a pitchfork standing beside a woman in front of a house built in the American Gothic Revival style. The models were the artist's sister Nan Wood Graham and his dentist, Dr. Byron McKeeby.
